policies.name: Cops Off Campus
resolvesTo: Maintain the SUC Voting Record as a publicly available and easily accessible resource.
Display individual officer and councillor voting history underneath their profile on the SU website (updated after each Council).
Create a dedicated space on the SU website for candidates to expand on their manifestoes and experience, with voting records clearly displayed (if applicable).

policies.name: Food for Future
resolvesTo: The SU will explicitly label Kosher, Halal, vegan, vegetarian, gluten-free and allergen friendly foods. Vegetarian options to be advertised before meat options on menus.
Have allergen friendly options for all of the top allergens, including vegetarian and vegan options.
Ensure the food offering across campus caters to International students.
To not sell red meat except pork and ensure ⅔ of options in all outlets are vegetarian and where feasible ⅓ of these are vegan.
Vegetarian food offered as standard for events catering, lobbying the university to do the same.
Oat milk will be offered as standard. Customers can request dairy milk. This will be monitored and a charge for dairy milk will be added if emissions do not drop.
Food emissions should be tracked by the SU, written on menus and publicised to students. Clear annual reduction goals will be set.
Prioritise the sale of affordable food by maintaining affordable meal deals, introducing more affordable hot food and guaranteeing an affordable option for all dietary needs at every outlet.
When replacing outlets, introduce a fully vegetarian/vegan outlet with international food offerings.
Host regular events, with a month that promotes plant based and sustainable diets.
